supporting.text: Leibniz published his version of calculus in 1684, which included notation and methods distinct from Newton's, supporting the idea of independent discovery.

attacks.text: Leibniz published his version of calculus in 1684, which included notation and methods distinct from Newton's, supporting the idea of independent discovery.

attacks.text: The Royal Society's 1712 report concluded that Newton was the first inventor of calculus, though Leibniz developed his version independently.
